definition: tall and erect, reaching through the clouds (idiom); used to describe tall mountain or skyscraper
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
surname Yun/abbr. for Yunnan Province 雲南省|云南省[Yun2 nan2 Sheng3]

sentences.english: Japan's Mount Fuji, covered with snow, stands amidst the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 日本富士山，山峰高耸入云，山巅白雪皑皑。
是玻璃幕墙高耸入云的闹市区？

sentences.english: The skyscraper rears high into the sky.
sentences.chinese: 这座摩天大楼高耸入云。

sentences.english: The skyscraper towers into the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 那幢摩天大楼高耸入云。

sentences.english: When you are inside the jungle, away from the river, the trees vault out of sight.
sentences.chinese: 当你离开大河，深入丛林，满眼树木高耸入云。

sentences.english: The skyscraper towers into the clouds .
sentences.chinese: 那幢摩天大楼高耸入云。

sentences.english: On mountain slopes that receive plentiful rainfall, huge Douglas firs rise in towering columns.
sentences.chinese: 在有充足降水的斜坡，巨大的道格拉斯枞树高耸入云。

sentences.english: Transmission lines built right among the clouds.
The highest peak lifts its majestic cone far into the clouds.
Immense skyscrapers reach high into the atmosphere, and stretch down deep into the dark shadows.
sentences.chinese: 摩天大楼高耸入云，却又深陷黑暗。

sentences.english: Soaring above the New York skyline, the Twin Towers were among the tallest buildings in the world.
sentences.chinese: “双子塔”高耸入云，曾是世界上最高的建筑之一。

definition: to tower/standing tall and upright (of large building)
as far as the eye can see
to stand tall and rock-solid (idiom)/towering majestically/(of a person) to stand up against sb
halfway up a mountain/lit. waist of mountain
